title: Emacs
summary: Emacs /ˈiːmæks/ or EMACS (Editor MACroS)[3][4][5] is a family of text editors that are characterized by their extensibility.[6] The manual for the most widely used variant,[7] GNU Emacs, describes it as "the extensible, customizable, self-documenting, real-time display editor".[8]  Development of the first Emacs began in the mid-1970s, and work on its direct descendant, GNU Emacs, continues actively as of 2021.
